answers.answer: Your age would make you a rare (but possible) heart attack candidate, but your weight and family history probably trump your age.  If for no other reason it probably would be a good idea to establish baselines for your heart function, the basic test most doctors would prescribe would be an EKG.  A relative of mine who is heavy and had chest pain during heavy exercise was told it probably was caused by constriction of lung space and he found the symptoms ended when he lost forty pounds.Best wishes.

You really shouldn't be jogging if you are experiencing these symptoms.  To be safe, you should set up a treadmill stress test and an echocardiogram with a cardiologist.  This will determine if you are experiencing heart related problems when you exercise. Good luck.

question: I am having some chest pains at the end of my jog and they continue for about 20-25 min. after I stop jogging.Background info:My Grandfather had 2-4 large heart attacks and had to have triple bypass surgery.My father had to have one of his arteries ballooned when he was around 38.My Uncle has diabetes (not sure what type)I am 21, 5'11'', 295lbs, non-smoker, non-drinker, not sure of cholesterol or blood pressure.This pain is on the right side of my chest between my nipples, and is equal distance from the center of my chest and my right nipple. It is sharp . After about 25 minutes it will go away.Any ideas on what this is and if I should go and see a cardiologist? If I do see one, any recommended tests I should take?Thanks so much!
title: Chest pain at end of jogging and after for about 20 min.
